title: Fillet of John Dory with black rice, langoustine claws, sweetcorn and tarragon
description: An elegant dish of fried fish, a crispy langoustine beignet and black rice, served with a rich sauce.
ingredients: John Dory heads (from below), gills and eyeballs removed
salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 large langoustine claws (or 8 peeled, raw prawn tails), meat removed from shell
125g/4½oz cooked langoustine claw meat, chopped (alternatively use cooked white crab meat)
1litre/1¾ pint vegetable oil, for deep frying
230ml/8fl oz black rice cooking liquor (reserved from above)
salt and freshly ground black pepper
4 x 550g/1lb 4oz John Dory fish, filleted and cut into 8 110g/4oz portions (ask your fishmonger to do this and give you the heads)
salt and freshly ground black pepper
